objective: how to make deep research feature for code bases

sub_tasks.task: Collect developer user requirements and detailed use cases for a deep research feature by conducting interviews or surveys on platforms like StackOverflow, GitHub Discussions, and relevant Slack/Discord communities
Survey existing code research and analysis tools (e.g., Sourcegraph, OpenGrok, GitHub Code Search) and review academic papers on code search and comprehension
Define core functionalities and success metrics, such as semantic search, dependency graph exploration, automated code summarization, and code quality analysis, referencing industry best practices
Research code representation and parsing techniques—ASTs, CFGs, program dependency graphs—and evaluate code embedding models (e.g., CodeBERT, GraphCodeBERT, StarCoder) for semantic analysis
Design system architecture including indexing pipeline, metadata storage (e.g., graph databases), retrieval API, and model serving infrastructure
Investigate machine learning and NLP models for semantic code search and summarization using datasets like CodeSearchNet and public GitHub corpora
Plan data sourcing and preprocessing from public repositories (GitHub, GitLab), addressing licensing, repository filtering, tokenization, and updating strategies
Design UI/UX prototypes and integration points (IDE plugins for VSCode/IntelliJ, web dashboard) using tools like Figma or Sketch
Establish an evaluation framework with quantitative metrics (precision/recall, latency, coverage) and qualitative measures (developer satisfaction, usability testing)
Identify potential knowledge gaps and challenges, including multi-language support, handling large-scale codebases, real-time index updates, and security/privacy concerns
